page.title: 13RHUM LIFELINE _ M/V RHOUMA
page.content:
This is a boat of wooden structure, Carvel built from larch planking on Troko frames. Her dimensions are length overall 39ft., beam 11ft., draught 4ft. 6in., and she is driven by a marinised Ford engine giving a speed of 8 knots.
She is used mainly as a ferryboat to take passengers (24 in the summertime & 12 in the wintertime), plus their luggage and any other cargo like the Mail, to & from McBrayne's steamer "Lochmor" which comes into Loch Scresort, to either the pier or slipway depending upon the state of the tide. This work is done on 4 days of the week.
